places.name: National Museum of Scotland
places.description: The National Museum of Scotland is a museum in Edinburgh, Scotland. It is the largest museum in the country and is home to a wide range of exhibitions and collections.
places.getting_there: Walkable from the centre of Edinburgh
tips: Free entry so no need to book.
Visit early morning or late evening to avoid crowds
Plan which exhibitions you would like to see.

places.name: Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum
places.description: The Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum is a gallery and museum in Glasgow, Scotland. It is home to a wide range of exhibitions and collections.
places.short_description: Art gallery and museum in Glasgow
places.getting_there: Easy to get to by Glasgow subway
tips: Free entry so no need to book.

places.name: Isle of Skye
places.description: The Isle of Skye is a small island in the Scottish Highlands, known for its dramatic landscapes, rugged coastline, and rich history.
places.best_time_to_visit: Spring (April to May) or Summer (June to August)
places.getting_there: Bus from Edinburgh or Glasgow to Skye

places.name: Loch Ness
places.description: Loch Ness is a large, deep freshwater lake in the Scottish Highlands. It is famous for the legendary Loch Ness Monster and its stunning natural beauty.
places.best_time_to_visit: Spring (April to May) or Summer (June to August)
places.getting_there: Drive from Inverness or take a tour bus

places.name: Ben Nevis
places.description: Ben Nevis is the highest mountain in the British Isles, located in the Grampian Mountains in Scotland. It offers challenging hikes and stunning views from the summit.
places.best_time_to_visit: Summer (June to August) or Autumn (September to November)
places.getting_there: Drive from Fort William or take a bus

places.name: Stirling Castle
places.description: Stirling Castle is one of the largest and most important castles in Scotland. It played a significant role in Scottish history and offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape.
places.best_time_to_visit: Spring (April to May) or Autumn (September to November)
places.getting_there: Drive from Edinburgh or Glasgow or take a train to Stirling
tips: Book tickets online to skip lines

places.name: St Andrews
places.description: St Andrews is a historic university town on the east coast of Scotland, famous for its medieval cathedral ruins, golf courses, and beautiful beaches.
places.best_time_to_visit: Spring (April to May) or Autumn (September to November)
places.getting_there: Drive from Edinburgh or take a train to St Andrews

places.name: Inverness Castle
places.description: Inverness Castle is a 19th-century castle in Inverness, Scotland. It sits on a hill overlooking the River Ness and offers stunning views of the city.

places.name: Cairngorms National Park
places.description: The Cairngorms National Park is the largest national park in the UK, covering a vast area of mountains, forests, and rivers in the Scottish Highlands.
places.short_description: Largest national park in the UK
places.best_time_to_visit: Summer (June to August) or Winter (December to February)

places.name: John o' Groats
places.description: John o' Groats is a village at the northernmost point of mainland Scotland, famous for its stunning coastal views and being the traditional starting point for the Land's End to John o' Groats journey.
highlights: Land's End to John o' Groats

places.name: Glencoe
places.description: Glencoe is a mountain glen in the Scottish Highlands, renowned for its dramatic landscapes, tragic history, and outdoor activities. The area is surrounded by towering mountains and offers stunning views of the surrounding countryside.
places.best_time_to_visit: Spring (April to May) or Autumn (September to November)
places.getting_there: Drive from Glasgow or Fort William

places.name: The Kelpies
places.description: The Kelpies are a pair of 30-meter-tall horse head sculptures located in Falkirk, Scotland. They are the largest equine sculptures in the world and are part of the Helix Park project.
places.getting_there: Drive from Edinburgh or Glasgow or take a train to Falkirk

places.name: Pollock Park
places.description: Pollock Park is a large public park in Glasgow, Scotland. It features beautiful gardens, a loch, and the historic Pollock House. The park offers various activities including boating, fishing, and walking trails.
places.best_time_to_visit: Spring (April to May) or Summer (June to August)
places.getting_there: Drive from Glasgow city center or take a bus
tips: Visit the house and art collection
Take a boat ride on the loch

places.name: Arthur's Seat
places.description: Arthur's Seat is the highest point in Edinburgh's Holyrood Park, offering stunning panoramic views of the city. It's a popular spot for hiking and outdoor activities, with several trails leading to the summit.
places.best_time_to_visit: Spring (April to May) or Autumn (September to November)

places.name: Holyrood Palace
places.description: Holyrood Palace is the official residence of the British monarch in Scotland. It's located at the end of the Royal Mile in Edinburgh and features beautiful gardens and historic apartments.
places.short_description: Official Scottish residence of the monarch
places.best_time_to_visit: Spring (April to May) or Autumn (September to November)
tips: Book tickets online to skip lines
Visit during the Changing of the Guard
